input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week began with a flurry of activity as we settled back into our routines. The weather remained chilly, with occasional light snow showers. My husband and I continued to discuss our career aspirations and how we can balance them with family time. Work was busy, with meetings and brainstorming sessions about the upcoming projects. I found myself diving deep into research for the energy-efficient building design, which has become a focal point for me. At home, the kids adjusted well to school, and we had a family game night on Saturday to unwind. The week ended with a cozy Sunday dinner, where we reflected on the past week and looked forward to the coming months.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The third week of the year saw a slight thaw in the weather, with temperatures creeping up slightly. My husband and I attended a local community event focused on environmental sustainability, which inspired us to look for more eco-friendly practices at home. Work was productive, with progress made on the energy-efficient building project. I also started planning for the upcoming parenting workshop, which is scheduled for the next week. The kids were excited about a field trip they had at school, and we spent the weekend exploring a nearby nature reserve, enjoying the crisp air and the budding signs of spring.

 Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):

We applied some of these strategies at home, which seemed to help with the kids’ bedtime routine. The week concluded with a family movie night, where we watched a heartwarming documentary about wildlife conservation.

input:
Emma is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 11), my wife (birthday on March 02), my child_1 (birthday on September 11), my father (birthday on August 19), my mother (birthday on August 30), 
2) Participating in a week-long sailing school in week 26-27.

3) Participate in a kite flying club every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week began with a flurry of activity as we settled back into our routines. The weather remained chilly, but the sun shone brightly, casting a crisp light over everything. Work was busy, with meetings and brainstorming sessions filling up my schedule. My team and I are working on a project that aims to integrate renewable energy sources into existing building structures, which is both exciting and challenging. At home, the kids adjusted well to school, and my wife and I found time to plan our upcoming vacation. We're thinking about a beach destination for the summer, something to look forward to during these cold months. On the weekend, we visited my parents, who were thrilled to see us. We spent the day catching up and enjoying a hearty meal together. It was a comforting reminder of the importance of family bonds.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The third week of the year brought a mix of work and family activities. The weather remained cold, but there was a hint of spring in the air, with occasional sunny spells. At work, we continued to make progress on the renewable energy project, and I had several productive discussions with colleagues. My wife and I also attended a local art exhibit, which was a refreshing break from the daily grind. The kids were excited about their school projects, particularly a science fair they’re preparing for. On the weekend, we participated in a community cleanup event, which was both rewarding and a great way to spend time outdoors. The sense of community and teamwork was inspiring, and it felt good to contribute to our neighborhood.

 Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week was filled with a mix of routine and special moments. The weather remained cold, but the days were getting slightly longer. At work, we finalized the initial phase of the renewable energy project and presented it to upper management, receiving positive feedback. My wife and I took the kids to a local ice rink, where they learned to skate. It was a fun and bonding experience, and the kids were thrilled to try something new. We also celebrated my husband’s birthday early this week, as his actual birthday falls in May. We had a small gathering with close friends and family, and everyone enjoyed a delicious cake and shared heartfelt wishes. The week ended with a cozy evening at home, watching a movie and reflecting on the past year.

 Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
The start of February brought a slight thaw, with temperatures rising a bit. At work, we continued to refine the renewable energy project, and I spent most of the week collaborating with my team. My wife and I focused on organizing our finances for the year, setting budgets and reviewing savings goals. The kids were busy with schoolwork and extracurricular activities, including a school play rehearsal. On the weekend, we visited a local museum, which featured an exhibition on ancient civilizations. It was educational and fascinating, sparking conversations about history and culture. The week concluded with a family dinner, where we shared our favorite parts of the week and made plans for the coming month.

 Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th):
This week was a blend of work and family activities. The weather remained mild, with occasional rain showers. At work, we had a series of meetings to discuss the next steps for the renewable energy project. My wife and I attended a parenting workshop, which provided valuable insights into supporting our children's emotional and academic growth. The kids were excited about their upcoming school play, and we spent the weekend helping them practice their lines. We also took a short trip to a nearby town, exploring its charming streets and enjoying a leisurely lunch at a local café. The week ended with a family game night, filled with laughter and friendly competition.

The seventh week of the year was filled with a mix of work and family events. The weather was still mild, with occasional rain. At work, we continued to make progress on the renewable energy project, and I had several productive discussions with colleagues. My wife and I focused on planning our summer vacation, researching destinations and activities. The kids were busy with schoolwork and preparing for their upcoming science fair. On the weekend, we visited a local botanical garden, which was a beautiful escape from the city. We spent the afternoon walking through the lush gardens, admiring the blooming flowers and enjoying a picnic lunch. The week concluded with a family movie night, where we watched a heartwarming documentary about nature conservation.

The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the office was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promised challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brought a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week began with a flurry of activity as I dove deeper into the preliminary designs for the new project. The team was excited about the potential impact of our work, and we spent several meetings brainstorming ideas and refining concepts. The weather remained chilly, but the sun shone brightly, casting a crisp, clear light over everything. My wife and I took advantage of the good weather to go for a longer walk in the park, enjoying the crisp air and the sight of icicles hanging from tree branches. Our son came home from school with a report card that showed significant improvement in his math scores, which was a pleasant surprise. We celebrated with a small dinner at home, where we talked about his progress and encouraged him to keep up the good work. The week ended with a cozy evening watching old movies and snuggling under blankets, feeling grateful for the simple joys of family life.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
The third week of the year saw a slight dip in temperature, bringing a touch of frost to the mornings. The children were equally engaged, showing an interest in the various pieces and asking thoughtful questions. We spent the weekend organizing the garage, sorting through old toys and books, and deciding what to donate. It was a productive way to spend time together while also decluttering our space. The week concluded with a family game night, filled with laughter and friendly competition, reinforcing the bonds we share.

The indoor exhibits provided a welcome respite from the cold, and we enjoyed walking through the lush greenery and colorful flowers. The children were thrilled to see the plants and learn about different species. The week ended with a family dinner at a favorite Italian restaurant, celebrating the small victories and looking forward to the coming months.

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

The kids were busy with school projects, and my wife and I focused on organizing our home and planning upcoming events. The weather remained mild, providing ideal conditions for outdoor activities. We took the kids to a local park, where they enjoyed playing on the playground and exploring nature trails. The week concluded with a relaxing evening at home, where we reviewed our plans and looked forward to the upcoming weeks. We celebrated the holidays with loved ones, sharing stories, laughter, and delicious meals. It was a wonderful way to cap off the year and look forward to the new adventures that lie ahead.

*** finished ***

Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. 5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for real estate agency use.
  - Designate Floor 77 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 71 for language school use.
  - Designate Floor 18 for veterinary clinic use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for retail store use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 3 to 9 for a advanced technology and research institute.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 40 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 15 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 94 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 52 for office use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 72 to 77 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a sky garden every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:
output_blocks:
Floor 1:

Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.

This floor aims to foster a dynamic and efficient working atmosphere.

This floor encourages interaction and creativity among staff members.

 Floor 4:

Key features include: 1) IT Department: A secure and climate-controlled room housing servers and other critical IT infrastructure, ensuring smooth operation of the building's technological systems. 2) HR Office: Comfortable and professional offices for human resources personnel, equipped with necessary tools for managing employee records and conducting interviews. 3) Training Rooms: Well-equipped training rooms for workshops and seminars, featuring advanced AV systems and comfortable seating arrangements. 4) Storage Areas: Secure storage areas for important documents and supplies, maintaining organization and accessibility. input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.19: Winter Solstice Feast featuring Venison Stew

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week, we focus on fresh seafood and vibrant flavors. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Seared Scallops: Succulent scallops seared to perfection, served with a lemon butter sauce. 1.2) Smoked Salmon Tartare: Finely chopped smoked salmon mixed with capers, onions, and herbs, served on a bed of avocado. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Pan-Seared Sea Bass: Fresh sea bass fillets pan-seared with a light seasoning, served with a white wine sauce. 2.2) Grilled Octopus: Tender octopus grilled and seasoned with olive oil, lemon, and herbs. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with olive oil and garlic. 3.2) Quinoa Salad: A colorful salad of quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and feta cheese. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Sorbet: Refreshing sorbet made with fresh lemons. 4.2) Raspberry Cheesecake: A creamy cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a raspberry topping. 5. Drinks: 5.1) White Wine: Light and crisp white wines to pair with the seafood. 5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing iced tea with a hint of mint.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-11 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week, we explore the rich flavors of the Mediterranean. 1. Side Dishes: 3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with garlic and olive oil. 3.2) Quinoa Salad: Quinoa mixed with cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and feta cheese, dressed with lemon vinaigrette. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy lemon filling encased in a buttery pastry crust. 4.2) Gelato: A variety of artisanal gelatos, including pistachio and stracciatella. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Rosé Wine: Light and refreshing rosé to pair with the seafood. 5.2) Limoncello: An Italian lemon liqueur to cleanse the palate.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week, we introduce our first Soup and Salad Midweek offering. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Smoked Salmon Tartare: Finely chopped smoked salmon mixed with capers, onions, and crème fraîche. 1.2) Avocado and Crab Salad: A refreshing blend of avocado, crab meat, and a light lemon vinaigrette. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef in red wine with mushrooms and pearl onions. 2.2) Pan-Seared Scallops: Succulent scallops seared to perfection, served with a buttery sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Seasonal Soup: A hearty winter soup made with root vegetables and herbs. 3.2) Mixed Green Salad: A crisp salad with a variety of greens, cherry tomatoes, and a balsamic dressing. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Apple Crumble: Warm apple crumble with a cinnamon streusel topping. 4.2) Vanilla Bean Ice Cream: Rich vanilla ice cream, perfect for cooling down after a warm meal. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Red Wine: A robust red wine to pair with the hearty main courses. 5.2) White Wine: A crisp white wine to complement the lighter dishes.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
Continuing with our winter theme, this week features rich and comforting dishes. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Foie Gras Terrine: A luxurious terrine of foie gras, served with toasted brioche. 1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and cheese, served with pita chips. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Coq au Vin: Chicken braised in red wine with mushrooms and bacon. 2.2) Wild Mushroom Risotto: A creamy risotto infused with wild mushrooms and parmesan cheese. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and a touch of balsamic vinegar. 3.2) Truffle Mashed Potatoes: Mashed potatoes enhanced with truffle oil and cream. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Caramel Flan: A smooth flan with a caramelized sugar top. 4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Soft and chewy cookies with chunks of dark chocolate. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Red Wine: A full-bodied red wine to match the rich flavors of the main courses. 5.2) Sparkling Wine: A sparkling wine to cleanse the palate between courses.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
This week, we feature another Soup and Salad Midweek offering. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Oysters Rockefeller: Oysters topped with a spinach and bacon mixture, baked until golden. 1.2) Goat Cheese and Fig Crostini: Toasted baguette slices topped with goat cheese and fig jam. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Osso Buco: Slow-cooked veal shanks with a rich tomato and wine sauce. 2.2) Seared Tuna Steak: Tuna steak seared to perfection, served with a soy-ginger glaze. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Seasonal Soup: A warming soup made with seasonal vegetables and herbs. 3.2) Mixed Green Salad: A fresh salad with a variety of greens, cucumbers, and a honey mustard dressing. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Bars: Tangy lemon bars with a shortbread crust. 4.2) Raspberry Sorbet: A refreshing sorbet to cool down after a rich meal. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Red Wine: A bold red wine to complement the hearty main courses. 5.2) White Wine: A crisp white wine to pair with the lighter dishes.

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
As we approach Valentine's Day, we prepare for a romantic and indulgent week. 1. input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'random of Year Party' on 11-06 with a special dish: Gourmet Cheese Platter.
1.4 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.5 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 08-31 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
2) Feature 'Squash and Pumpkin Delights' from Week 5 to Week 5 with dishes like: Pumpkin Pie.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 9, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.52: Christmas Gala Dinner featuring Roasted Goose
checks_once.11: Saint Patrick's Day featuring Irish Stew
checks_once.45: random of Year Party featuring Gourmet Cheese Platter
checks_once.24: Father's Day Feast featuring Barbecued Ribs
checks_once.35: Summer Solstice Celebration featuring Midsummer Night's Fish Fry

checks_range.5: Squash and Pumpkin Delights featuring Pumpkin Pie

This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Christmas Gala Dinner' on 12-25 with a special dish: Roasted Goose.
1.2 Celebrate 'Memorial Day BBQ' on 09-03 with a special dish: Smoked Brisket.
1.3 Celebrate 'Mother's Day Meal' on 05-13 with a special dish: Eggs Benedict with Salmon.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
This week, we explore the rich flavors of the Mediterranean. 1. Main Courses: 2.1) Paella Valenciana: Traditional Spanish rice dish with saffron, chicken, rabbit, and seasonal vegetables. 2.2) Grilled Swordfish: Thick swordfish steaks marinated in olive oil, lemon, and herbs, grilled to perfection. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus spears roasted with garlic and olive oil. 3.2) Saffron Rice: Fluffy rice infused with saffron threads. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Lemon Tart: A tangy lemon filling encased in a buttery pastry crust. 4.2) Almond Cake: A light, almond-flavored cake dusted with powdered sugar. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Rosé Wine: A crisp rosé to pair with the seafood. 5.2) Sangria: A refreshing blend of red wine, fruit juices, and fresh fruits.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
A week dedicated to hearty winter soups and stews. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Butternut Squash Soup: Creamy soup made from roasted butternut squash, garnished with crème fraîche. 1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichokes, and melted cheese, served with pita bread. 2. An exploration into Asian cuisine. 1. Side Dishes: 3.1) Caesar Salad: Crisp romaine lettuce with croutons, Parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing. 3.2) Garlic Bread: Soft bread brushed with garlic butter and baked until golden. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 4.2) Cannoli: Crispy shells filled with sweet ricotta cream. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Chianti: A robust red wine to pair with the pasta. 5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing iced tea with lemon.

 Menu Week 27 (July 2nd - July 8th):
Celebrating Bastille Day Party. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Foie Gras: Rich and creamy foie gras served with toast points. 1.2) Escargots: Snails cooked in garlic butter and herbs. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Coq au Vin: Chicken braised in red wine with mushrooms and onions. 2.2) Beef Bourguignon: Slow-cooked beef stew with red wine, onions, and mushrooms. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Ratatouille: A vegetable stew with eggplant, zucchini, and tomatoes. 3.2) French Fries: Crispy fries with aioli dipping sauce. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Crème Brûlée: A rich custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 4.2) Clafoutis: A fruit-filled dessert with a custard-like texture. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Bordeaux: A full-bodied red wine to complement the rich flavors. 5.2) Sparkling Water: A refreshing non-alcoholic option.

 Menu Week 28 (July 9th - July 15th):
Exploring the flavors of Spain. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Gazpacho: A cold soup made with tomatoes, cucumbers, and peppers. 1.2) Patatas Bravas: Fried potato cubes served with a spicy tomato sauce. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Paella Valenciana: Traditional Spanish rice dish with saffron, chicken, rabbit, and seasonal vegetables. 2.2) Grilled Octopus: Tender octopus grilled and served with a lemon and olive oil dressing. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Roasted Peppers: Bell peppers roasted and peeled, served with olive oil. 3.2) Saffron Rice: Fluffy rice infused with saffron threads. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Churros: Crispy fried dough sticks dusted with sugar and cinnamon. 4.2) Flan: A creamy custard dessert with caramel sauce. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Rioja: A full-bodied red wine to pair with the paella. 5.2) Sangria: A refreshing blend of red wine, fruit juices, and fresh fruits.

 Menu Week 29 (July 16th - July 22nd):
Exploring the flavors of Greece. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Tzatziki: A cool yogurt dip with cucumber, garlic, and dill. 1.2) Spanakopita: Spinach and feta cheese wrapped in phyllo dough. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Moussaka: A layered dish with eggplant, ground meat, and béchamel sauce. 2.2) Grilled Lamb Chops: Juicy lamb chops seasoned with herbs and grilled to perfection. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Greek Salad

Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:

2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the row from (7, 2) to (7, 5).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.

2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the column from (2, 8) to (3, 8).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a small park starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
